TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
Wow!

That last station is huge, the part count must be high

And actually that SSTO design is gorgeous. [/ quote]

SSTO Alchemyst ---> http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/60853-0-23-5-Alchemy-Technologies-products-v02?highlight=alchemy

Alchemyst is not my design...

My design is Clarion

Edited August 29, 2014 by kopapaka

On previous suggestions, the rotating panels have had a minor texture update.

New models will have to wait for now.

Smaller Cell surface on the top, shadow + better specular map.

finally texture on the back panels.

Nice. I like the textures on the back of those panels. Simple and they work.

A suggestion, if I may: The Mono capacity of the small MonoProp tank you added/readded with the reworked Vega seems a bit on the heavy side. It feels like it should be more in the 15-20 range, not anywhere near 30, but I've not really sat down to calc the volume of the sphere vs the accepted density of MonoProp. Thoughts?

I've repurposed the Tantares descent module into what I call a Mini-Tanta. Nothing more than a quick ferry to ~120km or so.... Not very comfortable, either, but it's cheap. (And about 40% recoverable with something like StageRecovery or DebRefund.) Even has a working launch escape system. Still needs a bit of work, as the panels clip slightly into the RCS pods. I could probably get away with not using the new MonoProp engines, but I'm impatient and needed the thrust.

Nice. I like the textures on the back of those panels. Simple and they work.

A suggestion, if I may: The Mono capacity of the small MonoProp tank you added/readded with the reworked Vega seems a bit on the heavy side. It feels like it should be more in the 15-20 range, not anywhere near 30, but I've not really sat down to calc the volume of the sphere vs the accepted density of MonoProp. Thoughts?

I've repurposed the Tantares descent module into what I call a Mini-Tanta. Nothing more than a quick ferry to ~120km or so.... Not very comfortable, either, but it's cheap. (And about 40% recoverable with something like StageRecovery or DebRefund.) Even has a working launch escape system. Still needs a bit of work, as the panels clip slightly into the RCS pods. I could probably get away with not using the new MonoProp engines, but I'm impatient and needed the thrust.

http://0div0.org/images/ksp/20140829_minitanta.jpg

Hi!

You're right about the capacity, they've been reduced to a capacity of 15 in the next release

I love the Mini-Tanta, think I'll build one myself!

My current crew shuttle costs 80K+ and is about 1% recoverable
Hurray re: textured backs of solar arrays!

Nice. I like the textures on the back of those panels. Simple and they work.
Hurray re: textured backs of solar arrays!

/agree. With that and the other WIP stuff, I'm Looking forward to the next release.
I like the retextures!

Is the parachute supposed to push the orbital module away or am I missing some kind of decoupler for the Soyuz?

Is the parachute supposed to push the orbital module away or am I missing some kind of decoupler for the Soyuz?

The parachute is supposed to push it away. Yes.

Your Soyuz, TKS and Salyut parts are works of art!

If you have some free time, perhaps you'll consider the the Soyuz launch vehicle--combined with your "Kerbal Soyuz", and I think you've got the best rival to Bobcat's Soyuz ever since the RocketCo model fell off the face of the earth.

In any case, great work!
